newsitem.title: USA: Raven agricultural electronics boost Q4.
newsitem.headline: Raven agricultural electronics boost Q4.

text.p: Raven Industries Inc said Wednesday that several new products in its agricultural electronics field boosted its top-line growth in the fourth quarter and fiscal year ended January 31.
"These products included precision depth controls for planting, tillage and harvesting operations," said president David Christensen in a statement.

The company's contract electronics business also was a strong performer, Christensen said, with sales doubling to $18 million in fiscal 1997. "We expect continuing future growth in this area," he added.
Christensen said operating income in the company's plastics segment was up 29 percent on a seven percent sales rise in fiscal 1997.
He said Raven had improved profit for its truck topper line but said "we need a great deal of further improvement to get this operation to an acceptable profit level."

In addition, he said the company's tank business saw a downturn in its agricultural segment in the first half, but posted a good second-half recovery. "Profits and sales for the full year, however, ended slightly below last year," Christensen said.
Christensen said Raven's sewn products, or special apparel segment, showed a strong recovery in fiscal 1997 with sales up 13 percent for the year and profits "making a substantial gain."

For the fourth quarter, Raven reported earnings of $0.45 per share, up from $0.34. Sales advanced to $38.4 million from $29.8 million. For the full year, earnings rose to $1.61 per share from $1.30 and sales gained to $139.4 million from $120.4 million.
